00013 /*
00014  * Junk instruction detector.
00015  */

00024 InstDigraphs digraphs;
00025 
00026 void
00027 inst_digraph_init(InstDigraphs *g)
00028 {
00029   memset(g, 0, sizeof(*g));
00030 }
00031 
00032 void
00033 inst_digraph_destroy(InstDigraphs *g)
00034 {
00035   int i;
00036   InstDigraphNode *prev, *cur;
00037 
00038   for (i = 0; i < INST_DIGRAPH_HASH_TABLE_SIZE; i++) {
00039     /* Free digraph nodes */
00040     cur = g->digraphs[i];
00041     while (cur) {
00042       prev = cur;
00043       cur = cur->next;
00044       free(prev);
00045     }
00046 
00047     /* Free count nodes */
00048     cur = g->counts[i];
00049     while (cur) {
00050       prev = cur;
00051       cur = cur->next;
00052       free(prev);
00053     }
00054   }
00055 }
00056 
00057 unsigned int
00058 inst_digraph_hash(unsigned char *o1, unsigned char *o2)
00059 {
00060   return ((o1[0] ^ o2[0]) ^ ((o1[1] ^ o2[1]) << 8)) &
00061     (INST_DIGRAPH_HASH_TABLE_SIZE - 1);
00062 }
00063 
00064 unsigned int
00065 inst_count_hash(unsigned char *o)
00066 {
00067   return ((o[0] ^ o[1]) ^ ((o[1] ^ o[2]) << 8)) &
00068     (INST_DIGRAPH_HASH_TABLE_SIZE - 1);
00069 }
00070 
00071 unsigned int
00072 inst_digraph_node_equals(InstDigraphNode *n,
00073   unsigned char *o1, unsigned char *o2)
00074 {
00075   return !memcmp(n->opcode, o1, 3) &&
00076     !memcmp(n->opcode + 3, o2, 3);
00077 }
00078 
00079 unsigned int
00080 inst_count_node_equals(InstDigraphNode *n, unsigned char *o)
00081 {
00082   return !memcmp(n->opcode, o, 3);
00083 }
00084 
00085 void
00086 inst_digraph_incr(InstDigraphs *g, Instruction *i1, Instruction *i2)
00087 {
00088   InstDigraphNode *cur;
00089   unsigned int hash = inst_digraph_hash(i1->opcode, i2->opcode);
00090 
00091   /* Search for existing digraph node */
00092   cur = g->digraphs[hash];
00093   while (cur) {
00094     if (inst_digraph_node_equals(cur, i1->opcode, i2->opcode))
00095       break;
00096     cur = cur->next;
00097   }
00098 
00099   if (!cur) {
00100     /* No node found, create a new one */
00101     if ((cur = (InstDigraphNode *) malloc(sizeof(*cur))) == NULL)
00102       fatal("inst_digraph_incr(): Unable to allocate new digraph node\n");
00103 
00104     cur->count = 1;
00105     memcpy(cur->opcode, i1->opcode, 3);
00106     memcpy(cur->opcode + 3, i2->opcode, 3);
00107 
00108     cur->next = g->digraphs[hash];
00109     g->digraphs[hash] = cur;
00110   } else {
00111     ++cur->count;
00112   }
00113 
00114   /* Search for existing count node */
00115   hash = inst_count_hash(i1->opcode);
00116   cur = g->counts[hash];
00117   while (cur) {
00118     if (inst_count_node_equals(cur, i1->opcode))
00119       break;
00120     cur = cur->next;
00121   }
00122 
00123   if (!cur) {
00124     /* No node found, create a new one */
00125     if ((cur = (InstDigraphNode *) malloc(sizeof(*cur))) == NULL)
00126       fatal("inst_digraph_incr(): Unable to allocate new count node\n");
00127 
00128     cur->count = 1;
00129     memcpy(cur->opcode, i1->opcode, 3);
00130 
00131     cur->next = g->counts[hash];
00132     g->counts[hash] = cur;
00133   } else {
00134     ++cur->count;
00135   }
00136 
00137   /* Update global count */
00138   ++g->count;
00139 }
00140 
00141 float
00142 inst_digraph_get(InstDigraphs *g, Instruction *i1, Instruction *i2)
00143 {
00144   InstDigraphNode *cur;
00145   unsigned int count, hash = inst_digraph_hash(i1->opcode, i2->opcode);
00146 
00147   /* Get digraph node */
00148   cur = g->digraphs[hash];
00149   while (cur) {
00150     if (inst_digraph_node_equals(cur, i1->opcode, i2->opcode))
00151       break;
00152     cur = cur->next;
00153   }
00154 
00155   if (!cur)
00156     return 0.0;
00157 
00158   count = cur->count;
00159 
00160   /* Get count node */
00161   hash = inst_count_hash(i1->opcode);
00162   cur = g->counts[hash];
00163   while (cur) {
00164     if (inst_count_node_equals(cur, i1->opcode))
00165       break;
00166     cur = cur->next;
00167   }
00168 
00169   if (!cur)
00170     fatal("inst_digraph_get(): Have digraph node but no count node?!\n");
00171 
00172   return count / cur->count;
00173 }
00174 
00175 float
00176 inst_count_get(InstDigraphs *g, Instruction *i)
00177 {
00178   InstDigraphNode *cur;
00179   unsigned int hash = inst_count_hash(i->opcode);
00180 
00181   /* Get count node */
00182   cur = g->counts[hash];
00183   while (cur) {
00184     if (inst_count_node_equals(cur, i->opcode))
00185       break;
00186     cur = cur->next;
00187   }
00188 
00189   if (!cur)
00190     return 0.0;
00191 
00192   /*  return cur->count / g->count; */
00193   return (float) cur->count / (float) g->count;
00194 }
00195 
00196 void
00197 inst_digraph_put(InstDigraphs *g, unsigned char *o1,
00198   unsigned char *o2, unsigned int c)
00199 {
00200   InstDigraphNode *cur;
00201   unsigned int hash = inst_digraph_hash(o1, o2);
00202 
00203   /* Find existing node */
00204   cur = g->digraphs[hash];
00205   while (cur) {
00206     if (inst_digraph_node_equals(cur, o1, o2))
00207       break;
00208     cur = cur->next;
00209   }
00210 
00211   if (cur) {
00212     /* Update existing node */
00213     cur->count = c;
00214   } else {
00215     /* No node found, create a new one */
00216     if ((cur = (InstDigraphNode *) malloc(sizeof(*cur))) == NULL)
00217       fatal("inst_digraph_put(): Unable to allocate new digraph node\n");
00218 
00219     cur->count = c;
00220     memcpy(cur->opcode, o1, 3);
00221     memcpy(cur->opcode + 3, o2, 3);
00222 
00223     cur->next = g->digraphs[hash];
00224     g->digraphs[hash] = cur;
00225   }
00226 }
00227 
00228 void
00229 inst_count_put(InstDigraphs *g, unsigned char *o, unsigned int c)
00230 {
00231   InstDigraphNode *cur;
00232   unsigned int hash = inst_count_hash(o);
00233 
00234   /* Find existing node */
00235   cur = g->counts[hash];
00236   while (cur) {
00237     if (inst_count_node_equals(cur, o))
00238       break;
00239     cur = cur->next;
00240   }
00241 
00242   if (cur) {
00243     /* Update existing node */
00244     cur->count = c;
00245   } else {
00246     /* No node found, create a new one */
00247     if ((cur = (InstDigraphNode *) malloc(sizeof(*cur))) == NULL)
00248       fatal("inst_count_put(): Unable to allocate new count node\n");
00249 
00250     cur->count = c;
00251     memcpy(cur->opcode, o, 3);
00252 
00253     cur->next = g->counts[hash];
00254     g->counts[hash] = cur;
00255   }
00256 }
00257 
00258 void
00259 inst_digraph_parse(InstDigraphs *g, FILE *s)
00260 {
00261   char buf[1024];
00262   int i, count, have_global_count = 0, have_inst_counts = 0;
00263   unsigned char opchars[3], opcodes[6];
00264 
00265   /*
00266    * Expected format is:
00267    * <global count>
00268    *
00269    * <instruction counts>
00270    * ...
00271    *
00272    * <digraph counts>
00273    * ...
00274    */
00275 
00276   while (fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), s)) {
00277 #ifdef INST_DIGRAPH_DEBUG
00278     fprintf(stderr, "DEBUG: line = %s", buf);
00279 #endif
00280 
00281     if (!have_global_count) {
00282       /* Get global count */
00283       if (sscanf(buf, "%u", &g->count)) {
00284 #ifdef INST_DIGRAPH_DEBUG
00285         fprintf(stderr, "DEBUG: global count = %d\n", g->count);
00286 #endif
00287         have_global_count = 1;
00288       }
00289 
00290       /* Eat separator line */
00291       fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), s);
00292     } else if (!have_inst_counts) {
00293       /* Check for instruction, digraph separator line */
00294       if (!strcmp(buf, "\n")) {
00295         have_inst_counts = 1;
00296         continue;
00297       }
00298 
00299       /* Get instruction opcodes */
00300       for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
00301         if (sscanf(buf + i * 2, "%2c", opchars) != 1)
00302           break;
00303         opchars[sizeof(opchars) - 1] = '\0';
00304         opcodes[i] = strtoul((char *) opchars, NULL, 16);
00305       }
00306 
00307       /* Check opcodes, get instruction count */
00308       if (i < 3 || sscanf(buf + 6, ": %d", &count) != 1)
00309         continue;
00310 
00311 #ifdef INST_DIGRAPH_DEBUG
00312       fprintf(stderr, "DEBUG: ");
00313       for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00314         fprintf(stderr, "%02x", opcodes[i]);
00315       fprintf(stderr, ": %d\n", count);
00316 #endif
00317 
00318       /* Update instruction count */
00319       inst_count_put(g, opcodes, count);
00320     } else {
00321       /* Get digraph opcodes */
00322       for (i = 0; i < 6; i++) {
00323         if (sscanf(buf + i * 2, "%2c", opchars) != 1)
00324           break;
00325         opchars[sizeof(opchars) - 1] = '\0';
00326         opcodes[i] = strtoul((char *)opchars, NULL, 16);
00327       }
00328 
00329       /* Check opcodes, get digraph count */
00330       if (i < 6 || sscanf(buf + 12, ": %d", &count) != 1)
00331         continue;
00332 
00333 #ifdef INST_DIGRAPH_DEBUG
00334       fprintf(stderr, "DEBUG: ");
00335       for (i = 0; i < 6; i++)
00336         fprintf(stderr, "%02x", opcodes[i]);
00337       fprintf(stderr, ": %d\n", count);
00338 #endif
00339 
00340       /* Update digraph count */
00341       inst_digraph_put(g, opcodes, opcodes + 3, count);
00342     }
00343   }
00344 }
00345 
00346 void
00347 inst_digraph_print(InstDigraphs *g)
00348 {
00349   int i, j;
00350   InstDigraphNode *cur;
00351 
00352   fprintf(stderr, "%d\n\n", g->count);
00353 
00354   for (i = 0; i < INST_DIGRAPH_HASH_TABLE_SIZE; i++) {
00355     cur = g->counts[i];
00356     while (cur) {
00357       for (j = 0; j < 3; j++)
00358         fprintf(stderr, "%02x", cur->opcode[j]);
00359       fprintf(stderr, ": %d\n", cur->count);
00360       cur = cur->next;
00361     }
00362   }
00363 
00364   fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00365 
00366   for (i = 0; i < INST_DIGRAPH_HASH_TABLE_SIZE; i++) {
00367     cur = g->digraphs[i];
00368     while (cur) {
00369       for (j = 0; j < 6; j++)
00370         fprintf(stderr, "%02x", cur->opcode[j]);
00371       fprintf(stderr, ": %d\n", cur->count);
00372       cur = cur->next;
00373     }
00374   }
00375 }
00376 
00377 unsigned char
00378 indep_regnum(unsigned char reg)
00379 {
00380   if (reg >= al_reg && reg <= bh_reg)
00381     return reg - al_reg;
00382   else if (reg >= ax_reg && reg <= di_reg)
00383     return reg - ax_reg;
00384   else if (reg >= eax_reg && reg <= edi_reg)
00385     return reg - eax_reg;
00386   else 
00387     return 255;
00388 }
00389 
00390 unsigned char
00391 reg_width(unsigned char reg)
00392 {
00393   if (reg >= eax_reg && reg <= edi_reg)
00394     return d_mode;
00395   else if (reg >= ax_reg && reg <= di_reg)
00396     return w_mode;
00397   else if (reg >= al_reg && reg <= bh_reg)
00398     return b_mode;
00399   else
00400     return 0;
00401 }
00402 
00403 unsigned char
00404 op_width(Operand *op)
00405 {
00406   unsigned char w = 0;
00407 
00408   switch (op->type) {
00409     case TRegister:
00410       w = reg_width(op->value.reg.num);
00411       break;
00412 
00413     case TMemLoc:
00414       w = d_mode;
00415       break;
00416 
00417     case TImmediate:
00418       w = op->value.imm.type;
00419       break;
00420 
00421     case TJump:
00422       w = op->value.jmp.type;
00423       break;
00424 
00425     case TFloatRegister:
00426       w = reg_width(op->value.freg.num);
00427       break;
00428 
00429     default:
00430       fatal("op_width(): Invalid operand type (%#x)\n", op->type);
00431   }
00432 
00433   return w;
00434 }
00435 
00436 unsigned int
00437 is_mov(Instruction *i)
00438 {
00439   unsigned char c = i->opcode[0];
00440 
00441   if ((c >= 0x88 && c <= 0x8c) ||
00442     (c == 0x8e) ||
00443     (c >= 0xa0 && c <= 0xa3) ||
00444     (c >= 0xb0 && c <= 0xbf) ||
00445     (c >= 0xc6 && c <= 0xc7))
00446     return 1;
00447   return 0;
00448 }
00449 
00450 unsigned int
00451 is_mul(Instruction *i)
00452 {
00453   unsigned char c = i->opcode[0];
00454 
00455   switch (c) {
00456     default:
00457       return 0;
00458   }
00459 }

00462 is_div(Instruction *i)

00464   unsigned char c = i->opcode[0];
00465 
00466   switch (c) {
00467     default:
00468       return 0;
00469   }
00470 }

00472 unsigned int
00473 is_shift(Instruction *i)
00474 {
00475   unsigned char c = i->opcode[0];
00476 
00477   switch (c) {
00478     default:
00479       return 0;
00480   }
00481 }

00483 unsigned int
00484 is_uncommon_arithmetic(Instruction *i)
00485 {
00486   if (is_mul(i) || is_div(i) || is_shift(i))
00487     return 1;
00488   return 0;
00489 }
00490 
00491 unsigned int
00492 is_special_reg(Operand *o)
00493 {
00494   switch (o->value.reg.num) {
00495     case es_reg:
00496     case cs_reg:
00497     case ss_reg:
00498     case ds_reg:
00499     case fs_reg:
00500     case gs_reg:
00501     case sp_reg:
00502     case bp_reg:
00503     case si_reg:
00504     case di_reg:
00505     case esp_reg:
00506     case ebp_reg:
00507     case esi_reg:
00508     case edi_reg:
00509       return 1;
00510 
00511     default:
00512       return 0;
00513   }
00514 }

00517 
00518 static int
00519 is_bad_instruction(Instruction *inst)
00520 {
00521   const char *template_val;
00522 
00523   if (inst->opcode[1]) {
00524     template_val = i386_op_2[inst->opcode[0]].mnemonic;
00525   }
00526   else if (inst->opcode[0] >= 0xD8 && inst->opcode[0] <= 0xDF) {
00527 
00528     unsigned char mod, reg, rm;
00529     
00530     mod = (inst->modrm >> 6) & 0x03;
00531     reg = (inst->modrm >> 3) & 0x07;
00532     rm = inst->modrm & 0x07;
00533 
00534     if (mod != 3)
00535       template_val = float_mem[(inst->opcode[0] - 0xd8) * 8 + reg];
00536     else {
00537       struct i386_op *dp = &float_reg[inst->opcode[0] - 0xd8][reg];
00538       if (dp->mnemonic)
00539   template_val = dp->mnemonic;
00540       else
00541   template_val = fgrps[dp->bytemode1][rm];
00542     }
00543   }
00544   else {
00545     if (onebyte_is_group[inst->opcode[0]]) {
00546       int table_index = i386_op_1[inst->opcode[0]].bytemode1;
00547       template_val = i386_group_1[table_index][(inst->modrm >> 3) & 0x07].mnemonic;
00548     }
00549     else
00550       template_val = i386_op_1[inst->opcode[0]].mnemonic;
00551   }
00552 
00553   if (template_val) 
00554     if (!strcmp(template_val, "(bad)"))
00555       return 1;
00556   
00557   return 0;
00558 }

00563 
00564 float
00565 score_junk_insts(Instruction *last, Instruction *cur)
00566 {
00567   float tmp, score = 0.0;
00568   Operand *o1, *o2, *o3;
00569   char m1, m2;
00570 
00571   /* Special case 0x00 opcode and 0x00 mod/rm */
00572   if (cur->opcode[0] == 0x00 && cur->length == 2 && cur->modrm == 0)
00573     score += WEIGHT_0x00_OPCODE;
00574 
00575   /* dislike NOPs and (bad) operations */
00576   if (is_bad_instruction(cur))
00577     return 1.0;
00578 
00579   if (cur->opcode[0] == 0x90)
00580     score += WEIGHT_NOP;
00581   
00582 
00583   /* Check instruction counts */
00584   tmp = inst_count_get(&digraphs, cur);
00585   score += (1.0 - tmp) * WEIGHT_INST_COUNT;
00586 
00587   /* Check instruction digraphs */
00588   if (last)
00589     score += (1.0 - inst_digraph_get(&digraphs, last, cur)) * WEIGHT_INST_DIGRAPH;
00590 
00591   if (cur->ops[0].type != TNone) {
00592     /*
00593      * One operand checks.
00594      */
00595     o1 = cur->ops;
00596 
00597     /* Check for unexpected arithmetic on special-purpose registers */
00598     if (is_uncommon_arithmetic(cur) && is_special_reg(o1))
00599       score += WEIGHT_ARITHMETIC_SPECIAL_REG;
00600 
00601     if (cur->ops[1].type != TNone) {
00602       /*
00603        * Two operand checks.
00604        */
00605       o2 = cur->ops + 1;
00606   
00607       /* Check for mismatched operand sizes */
00608       m1 = op_width(o1);
00609       m2 = op_width(o2);
00610   
00611       if (m1 < m2)
00612         /* w00t */
00613         score += WEIGHT_INST_OP_SIZE_MISMATCH;
00614   
00615       /*
00616        * Check for moving register contents into memory reference
00617        * by same register, or vice versa.
00618        */
00619       if (o1->type == TRegister && o2->type == TMemLoc) {
00620         if (indep_regnum(o1->value.reg.num) == indep_regnum(o2->value.mem.base))
00621           score += WEIGHT_INST_MOV_REG_OWN_REF;
00622       } else if (o1->type == TMemLoc && o2->type == TRegister) {
00623         if (indep_regnum(o2->value.reg.num) == indep_regnum(o1->value.mem.base))
00624           score += WEIGHT_INST_MOV_REG_OWN_REF;
00625       }
00626 
00627       /*
00628        * Check for a move from a register other than %ebp into %esp,
00629        * and vice versa.
00630        */
00631       if (is_mov(cur) && o1->type == TRegister && o2->type == TRegister &&
00632         ((o1->value.reg.num == esp_reg && o2->value.reg.num != ebp_reg) ||
00633         (o1->value.reg.num == ebp_reg && o2->value.reg.num != esp_reg)))
00634         score += WEIGHT_INST_MOV_EBP_ESP_MISMATCH;
00635   
00636       if (cur->ops[2].type != TNone) {
00637         /*
00638          * Three operand checks.
00639          */
00640         o3 = cur->ops + 2;
00641       }
00642     }
00643   }
00644 
00645   if (score > 1.0)
00646     score = 1.0;
00647 
00648   return score;
00649 }
00650 
00651 float
00652 update_junk_score(Instruction *newinst, Instruction *next,
00653   float orig, unsigned int num)
00654 {
00655   float weight_1, weight_2, cnt, result, score;
00656 
00657   score = score_junk_insts(next, newinst);
00658   
00659   cnt = (float) num;
00660   
00661   weight_1 = cnt / (cnt + 1.0);
00662   weight_2 = 1.0 - weight_1;
00663 
00664   result = (weight_1 + weight_2 * score) * orig;
00665 
00666   return result;
00667   /* return (score_junk_insts(newinst, next) + orig) / (num + 1); */
00668 }
00669 
00670 float
00671 detect_junk_insts(bfd_vma start, bfd_vma end)
00672 {
00673   Instruction *inst = NULL, *last = NULL;
00674   unsigned int i, num = 0;
00675   float score = 0.0;
00676   Segment *segment = get_segment_of(start);
00677 
00678   for (i = start; i < end; i += inst->length, num++) {
00679     /* Bail if instruction hasn't been decoded */
00680     if (!segment->insts[i - segment->start_addr])
00681       break;
00682 
00683     /* Get instruction */
00684     inst = segment->insts[i - segment->start_addr];
00685 
00686     /* Update anomaly score */
00687     score += score_junk_insts(last, inst);
00688 
00689     last = inst;
00690   }
00691 
00692   return score / num;
00693 }
